title: App Version update - updated
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user logged in to the app
custom_steps:
WHEN MLB Play app is left in background
AND MLB Play app version is upgraded by installing a new version
custom_expected:
THEN User should be on latest version, should be logged in and all data retained.

Profile -> Settings -> OS Version should be at the bottom.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN loading previous production version from AppStore or Google Play store.
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN previous version installs properly

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user logs in
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN login is successful.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user goes to Profile > Settings > App V (at the bottom)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN previous app version is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user downloads the production version from  TestFlight
AND opens the new version of the app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the new version of the app loads properly 
AND User remains logged in.

NOTE - This is the most important thing to verify - the DB/user's login data is preserved and then user doesn't have to login again.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user goes to Profile > Settings > App V (at the bottom)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the upgraded app version is displayed

title: Bottom Navigation Bar. (updated)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user MLB Play app installed on device 
AND user logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user opens the app
custom_expected:
THEN user should be landed on the Games Tab by default
AND user should displayed with nav bar on the bottom (Games  Results Profile)
AND there should be icons above the tab name
AND user should be able to navigate back and forth without having any issues
AND relevant pages should be opened

title: Splash Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user MLB Play app open/installed on device 
AND User not Logged in

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user not logged in
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should see a splash page that asks user to Log In or Sign Up

AND user able to select any option from Log In or Sign Up
(Log In/ Sign Up functionality can be full tested with respective Log In and Sign Up test cases)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is detected as Logged In
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN for logged in user, bypass this page and send user back to the home page (Games Tab)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user detected as not Logged In
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should display with splash page

(Along with Log In/Sign Up option on the page)
AND Splash page should match with the design (Header, image, text and background image)

title: Sign Up page updated
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user goes through the Sign up flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the sign up page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with
* title “Sign Up” 
* back arrow in the top left corner
* copy 'Join the fun of MLB Play with a FREE MLB account.' 
* An email text field with 
* A Nickname text field 
* A password field
* A Birthdate MM/DD/YYY text field with 
* Legal copy 'By signing up, I acknowledge that I have read, understand and agree to be bound by MLB's Terms of Use and Privacy Policy'. 
* A greyed out sign up button
* Already have an account? Log In. Log In is a link

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on Terms of Use
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Terms of Use Agreement page opens in a webview

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on Privacy Policy
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN MLB Privacy Policy page opens in a webview

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters the information in all the fields
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Sign Up button becomes blue and active

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on Log In
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Log In page opens

title: Sign Up flow - updated
custom_preconds: GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user opens the MLB PLay app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user sees the splash page (separate TC)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on 'Sign Up' or 'Don't have an account? Sign Up' links
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with 'Sign Up' page (separate TC)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on back arrow
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to the splash screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters information in all fields and clicks in 'Sign Up' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with the Notification page (separate TC)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects the notification option
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with 'Select Your Favorite Team' page (separate TC)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects their favorite team and clicks 'Next'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to the Games tab

title: Sign Up - error messages - updated
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user goes through the Sign up flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WEHN user enters an invalid email address in Email Address field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with an error message 'Please enter a valid email address'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters an invalid Nickname
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with an error message 'Nickname must be 6-15 characters long'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters Password on the Password field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be displayed with checkmark against the requirement for the password 

Note: All option are displayed below the Password and user will display with Red color for invalid entries and checkmark filled with white background for the valid entry

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters an invalid Password and clicks on another text field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with an error message 'Your password does not meet the requirement'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is on Birthdate field and enters a birthday > 21 year old
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with 'You must be at least 21 years of age to access MLB Play.'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is on Birthdate field and enters a future date
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with an error message 'Please enter a correct birthdate.'

title: iOS - Favorite Team - updated
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
AND user on Profile tab -> Settings -> Favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the favorite team selection page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with:

* 'Select Teams to Follow' title
* Favorite team header
* Following team header
* All teams with their logos and names (make sure logos and names are up to date)
* list of all teams
* 'Save' button
* 'Skip for now' link

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the '+' icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN selected team appears under 'Favorite team' section and is removed from 'All Teams' section
AND 'Next' button is enabled

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user removes the pick
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the 'Next' button gets disabled

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects another team
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN selected team appears under Followed team section and is removed from 'All Teams' section (there can be only one favorite team)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps and hold 3 line icon on the right
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user can drag the selected team between the sections

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the '-' icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN selected team is removed from the favorite or following team
AND selected team appears back in All Team section

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks 'Next'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to Games tab and selected favorite team is displayed in user's avatar and wallpaper

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on 'Skip for now'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to Games tab

title: Android - Favorite Team - updated
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB  Play app installed on Device
AND user is going through Sign Up flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the favorite team selection page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with:

* 'Select Your Favorite Team' title
* Grid of all teams with their logos and names (make sure logos and names are up to date)
* Selected team has a red border 
* 'Next' button 
* 'Skip for now' link

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects a team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN selected team has a red border 
AND 'Next' button is enabled

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user removes the pick
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the 'Next' button gets disabled

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on 'Skip for now'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to the Games tab

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks 'Next'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought back to the Setting page and selected favorite team is displayed in user's avatar and wallpaper

title: Notification page - updated
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user goes through the Sign up flow
AND user is on Notification page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the Notification page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be displayed with

* title “Notifications” 
- picture/icon in the middle of the screen
- below the picture should be the message “MLB Play uses push notifications to notify you of available games, important updated, and your scores.”
- and there should be a clickable "Enable In Settings" and "Skip this for now" buttons

custom_steps_separated.content: If user clicks on 'Enable Notifications'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is taken to device settings - MLB Play

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user click 'Skip for now'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to the Games tab in the app

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enables notification in device settings
custom_steps_separated.expected: WHEN user goes back to the app, user sees the copy 'Notifications are enabled. You'll be notified of available games, important updates, and your scores.'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user disables notification in device settings
custom_steps_separated.expected: WHEN user goes back to the app, user sees the copy 'Notifications are disabled. MLB Play uses push notifications to notify you of available games, important updates, and your scores.'

title: Login UI - updated
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user goes through the Log In flow
custom_steps:
[Android] WHEN user taps 'Log in with MLB' link
OR
[iOS] WHEN user taps 'Log in with another MLB account' link
custom_expected:
THEN Log In screen is displayed:
* Email textfield
* Password textfield
* Log In button

Don't have an account? Sign Up link (iOs/Android)
Forgot Password? link (ANDROID) (Above the copy of TOS and PP and Log In)
Forgot Password? (iOS) - (Above the copy of TOS and PP and Log In)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is viewing the Log In page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with
* "Log In" title
* copy 'Join the fun of MLB Play with your MLB account.'
* Email Address fiend
* Password field
* copy 'By logging in, I agree to MLB's Terms of Use and Privacy Policy.
* 'Forgot Password?' link
* 'Log In' button (grayed out)
* 'Don't have an account? Sign Up'

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user viewing the Log In page
And taps the text entry fields
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the keyboard will slide up into view
[iOS] AND tapping anywhere will dismiss the keyboard
[Android] AND tapping the device bottom nav downarrow will dismiss the keyboard

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is viewing the Log In page
And taps the "Don't have an account? Sign Up" link
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the view will transition to the Sign Up page

title: Log In flow - freshly installed app - updated
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user has an MLB account

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user opens the MLB Play app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with splash screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on 'Log in with MLB' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with Log In page

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters Email Address and Password 
AND clicks on 'Log In' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to the Games tab

title: App Tracking Transparency for existing users - updated
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user created a profile in MLB.com and never logged in MLB Play app

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user log in to the app for the first time
AND is on the EULA page (Agree to Term page)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the App Tracking Transparency (ATT) is prompt 

Things to display: 
* title 'Allow "MLB Play" to track your activity across other companies' apps and websites?'
* copy ' This allows MLB PLay to provide you with a more personalized playing experience
* Ask App not ot Track 
* Allow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks 'Allow'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Allow Tracking switch should be ON

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks 'Ask App not to Track'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Allow Tracking switch should be OFF

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user closes the app and logs back in
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the App Tracking Transparency (ATT) is  not prompt

title: iOS keychain functionality - updated
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user has no other MLB apps on device
AND user downloads MLB Play app

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user opens the MLB Play app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN there should be a “Log in with MLB” button on the login screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is logged in in another MLB app on their device
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user’s email address is shown, and the “Continue with MLB” button is added that allows them to continue their log in.

'Log In with another MLB account' is displayed
'New to MLB? Sign Up' is displayed
('Log In' and 'Sign Up' are light bold)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on 'Continue with MLB' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is able to proceed to the app using their account

title: Log In - error messages - updated
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on device 
AND user is going through Log In flow

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters invalid email and valid password 
AND clicks on 'Log In' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with 'Please enter a valid email address'

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters valid email, invalid password 
AND clicks on 'Log In' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with 'Please enter a valid email/Password'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters valid email and password
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN no error message is displayed

title: 'Forgot Password?' link - updated
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the MLB Play app on device 
AND the user has existing account
AND the user is on Log In page
custom_steps: WHEN user taps 'Forgot Password?' link
custom_expected: THEN Reset Password Page is shown allowing user to reset their password

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is viewing the Reset Password page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Reset Password will be shown as the title with a back navigation arrow
AND beneath the header there is text to instruct the user to reset password
* [Android] - Forgot Password 

Recover your Account
"Email Address field . We'll send you an email with a link to reset your password."
* [iOS] - Then user display with Web url https://www.mlb.com/forgot-password

for reseting the password 

Forgot Password 
Please enter your e-mail address below and we'll send a link to reset your password.
Email field 
Reset Password radio button
AND an email field is shown above 'Submit' button

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN email address input field is unpopulated
and the "submit" button is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an error prompt is shown
* [Android] "Reset Password Failed." - "Please enter a valid email address." (this is within the app) 
* [iOS] - Open Web link to fill the form

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps "OK" on error prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Reset Password page is shown as the title with a back navigation arrow

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters an Email address that does not conform to standard email rules (i.e @ symbol missing, domain missing)
AND taps the Submit Button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an error prompt is shown
* [Android] "Reset Password Failed." - "Please enter a valid email address."
* [iOS] - TODO: CONFIRM

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps "OK" on error prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Reset Password page is shown as the title with a back navigation arrow

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user disables the network (setting device to airplane mode is one way to achieve this)
WHEN the user is viewing the Reset Password page
AND the user enters an Email address that does confirm to standard email rules (i.e example@example.com)
AND taps the Submit Button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an error prompt is shown
* [Android] "Reset Password Failed." - "Password recovery failed."
* [iOS] - TODO: CONFIRM

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps "OK" on error prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Reset Password page is shown as the title with a back navigation arrow

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user enables the network
WHEN the user is viewing the Reset Password page
AND the user enters an Email address that does confirm to standard email rules (i.e example@example.com)
AND taps the Submit Button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Reset Password page is shown as the title with a back navigation arrow
AND the email field and submit are no longer shown, INSTEAD is shown "Reset password instructions have been sent to your email."

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user accesses their email containing a Reset Password link
AND user completes needed actions to successfully reset the password
AND user returns to MLB PREDICT app (Reset Password page, if prev minimized)
AND user logs in with new password
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is logged in successfully with newly reset password.

title: Update your Account - updated
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB PLAY app is installed on device 
AND user has existing account with missing nickname
AND user is on Log In page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user logs in
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with Update Your Account page

* 'Update Your Account' title
* copy ' To complete your log in, update your MLB account by creating a nickname and providing your birthdate.'
* Back arrow on the top left
* 'Nickname' field
* 'Birthdate' field
* 'Update & Loh In' button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the back arrow
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought back to the splash page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters an invalid Nickname
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the error message is displayed 'Nickname must contain only letters and numbers'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters a valid Nickname
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the 'Update & Log In' button gets active

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on 'Update & Log In' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to Games tab

title: Game cards
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user MLB Play app installed on device
AND user logged in
custom_steps:
WHEN user logged in
and on Games page
custom_expected: THEN user should display with BTS and QUICKPICK Game card respectively

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user view the game card before contest activated
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should not see Checkmark or Locked icon on game card

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user view the game card after contest played
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should display with Checkmark on game card

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user view the game card after contest locked
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should display with lock icon on contest card

title: Profile and Sub section - updated
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on device
AND user logged in
AND user is on Profile page
custom_steps: WHEN user is on Profile page
custom_expected:
THEN user should be displayed with 

* Settings icon on Top right 
* Profile header 
* Avatar and Wallpaper 
* icon for changing Avatar/Wallpaper 
* User nickname

title: Avatar List Page + Details View + flow - updated
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on device 
AND user is logged in
AND user navigates to Profile page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on the Avatar icon (Square icon)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Avatar List Page should be displayed

Things to be displayed on the page: 
* Avatars title
* Back arrow on the top left
* 'Unlock avatars with tokens. Pick any unlocked avatar to customize your profile.'
* grid of available avatars. First, the avatars user earned should be displayed, second,  avatars that user hasn’t earned yet. Unearned avatars have a “locked” image.
* user's current portrait should have a white border

custom_steps_separated.content:
For both earned and unearned avatars, the user should be able to click on the image to open a details view for that avatar. 
WHEN user taps on earned avatar
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the avatar page will be displayed with the selected avatar.

Things to be displayed: 
* Avatars title
* exit button on the top right corner
* selected avatar
* avatar's title
* short description of the avatar
* active 'Set As Your Avatar' button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects new avatar and taps on ‘Set As Your Avatar’
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN a newly selected Avatar is displayed on the user’s profile. User is brought back to their Profile page.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects the current avatar
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the CTA button is gray
AND button is unclickable 
AND the CTA copy is 'Currently Active Avatar'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on unearned avatar
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the avatar page will be displayed with the selected avatar.

Things to be displayed: 
* Avatars title
* exit button on the top right corner
* selected avatar with lock image
* avatar's title
* short description of the avatar
* non-active 'Set As Your Avatar' button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user click on the exit button on the Avatars View page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user will be taken to the Avatar List page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the back arrow on the Avatars page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user will be taken to the Profile page

title: Wallpaper List Page + Details View + flow - updated
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on device
AND user is logged in
AND user navigates to Profile page
custom_expected:
The background should be the same color as the user’s favorite team.
The user is able to edit/customize the background.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on the Wallpaper (Square icon)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Wallpapers List Page should be displayed

Things to be displayed on the page:
* Wallpapers title
* Back arrow on the top left corner
* 'Unlock wallpapers with tokens. Pick any unlocked wallpaper to customize your profile.'
* grid of available wallpapers. First, the wallpaper user earned should be displayed, second, the wallpaper that user hasn’t earned yet. Unearned wallpaper have a “locked” image.
* user's current portrait should have a white border

custom_steps_separated.content:
For both earned and unearned wallpapers, the user should be able to click on the image to open a details view for that wallpaper.
WHEN user taps on earned wallpaper
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the wallpapers page will be displayed with the selected wallpaper.

Things to be displayed:
* Wallpapers title
* exit button on the top right corner
* selected wallpaper
* wallpaper's title
* short description of the wallpaper
* active 'Set As Your Wallpaper' button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects a new wallpaper and taps on ‘Set As Your Wallpaper’
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN a newly selected wallpaper is displayed on the user’s profile. User is brought back to their Profile page.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects the current wallpaper
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the CTA button is gray
AND button is unclickable
AND the CTA copy is 'Currently Active Wallpaper'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on unearned wallpaper
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the wallpaper page will be displayed with the selected wallpaper.

Things to be displayed:
* Wallpapers title
* exit button on the top right corner
* selected wallpaper with lock image
* wallpaper's title
* short description of the wallpaper
* non-active 'Set As Your Wallpaper' button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user click on the exit button on the Wallpapers View page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user will be taken to the Wallpapers List page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the back arrow on the Wallpapers page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user will be taken to the Profile page

title: Settings Menu - updated
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user app installed on the device
AND user logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user navigate to Profile -> Settings Menu

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user navigate to Profile -> Settings Menu
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be displayed with 

1. Your Friend Code
2. Favorite Team: <Team Name if selected already>  
3. Notifications  
4. Account 
5. Beat the Streak Podcast

App Version should display at the bottom

title: Removing friends from profile page (updated)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on device
AND user is logged in
AND user has friends
AND user navigates to Profile page
AND user scrolls down to Friends section
AND user clicks on 'See All' CTA

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is 'Your Friends' page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user will display with remove icon (icon vary based on platform)

custom_steps_separated.content:
iOS: 
WHEN user swipes left on the friend
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the red 'X' button is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
iOS: WHEN the user taps on the 'X' button
Android:
WHEN the user taps on the person icon with the dash on the friend's line
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be displayed with 

Copy: 

Are You Sure? 
This friend will no longer appear on your leaderboard. You can always share a link to add them again.'
 
'Cancel' button (gray background)
'Remove' button (blue background) or 'Delete' on Android

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on Cancel
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN User should be taken back to  'Your Friends' page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on Delete
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN selected friend is removed from user's friends list

title: Your Friend Code flow (updated)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB  Play app installed on Device
AND user is logged in
AND user is on Profile -> Settings -> Your Friend Code

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user types in 6 digit code and deletes one digit
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the error message 'Please enter a 6-digit token' appears (in orangish)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters correct code and Tap on Add a Friend button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with the message 'Success! $friendname$ added (in green)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user navigates to Friend section
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with the friend they added in step 2

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters an invalid code
custom_steps_separated.expected: After user taps 'Add a Friend' button, the error message appears 'Invalid code. Please try again' (in red) above the Add a Friend CTA

title: Adding self as friend through code (updated)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB  Play app installed on Device
AND user is logged in
AND user is on profile page -> Settings -> Your Friend Code
custom_steps: WHEN user types their own code to the friend's code field
custom_expected:
THEN user sees the error message as a modal: “Looks like you're trying to add yourself as a friend. Check the code and try again.”
AND user does not see themselves in the friends list

title: Diamond Derby flow (updated)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user logged in to the app
AND user is on Games tab

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the Diamond Derby card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the DD card is colorful and no checkmark or lock is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user played the DD game
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the DD card has a checkmark icon (no matter how many picks user made)

AND user is displayed in the All and Friends leaderboard (Today (Bases)) with the current score
If user did a home run, then user should be displayed in the Season (runs) leaderboard

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN all games are final
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the DD card has a lock icon
AND user is not able to make any more picks

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN all games are final
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should receive the scores

AND the Feed tab should display: 
* DD contest score
* trophy / badge if applicable

AND user should receive XP for playing even if no correct picks and tokens for every correct pick
AND scores should be updated in the XP/tokens bar in the Games tab and Profile tab
AND the final score should be updated in the leaderboards

title: Beat the Streak flow (updated)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user logged in to the app
AND user is on Games tab

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the Beat the Streak card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the BTS card is colorful and no checkmark or lock is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user played the BTS game
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the BTS card has a checkmark icon (no matter how many picks user made)
AND user is NOT displayed in any leaderboard (unless user played earlier and has or had streaks)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN all games are final
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the BTS card has a lock icon
AND user is not able to make any more picks for today

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN all games are final
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should receive the scores

AND the Feed tab should display: 
* BTS contest score
* trophy / badge if applicable

AND user should receive XP for playing even if no correct picks and tokens for every correct pick
AND scores should be updated in the XP/tokens bar in the Games tab and Profile tab
AND user should appear in the leaderboards (Active Streak, All Season) for both All and friends

title: Quick Pick flow (updated)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user logged in to the app
AND user is on Games tab

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the Quick Pick card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the QP card is colorful and no checkmark or lock is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user played the QP game
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the QP card has a checkmark icon (user has to make picks for all 7 questions)
AND user is NOT displayed in any leaderboard

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN all games are final
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the QP card has a lock icon
AND user is not able to make any more picks for today

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN all games are final
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should receive the scores

AND the Feed tab should display: 
* QP contest score
* trophy / badge if applicable

AND user should receive XP for playing even if no correct picks and tokens for every correct pick
AND scores should be updated in the XP/tokens bar in the Games tab and Profile tab
AND user should appear in the leaderboards (Weekly and All Season) for both All and friends

title: EOG PN for Beat the Streak
EOG PN for Beat the Streak (updated)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user logged in to the app
AND user has notifications on

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user played the Beat the Streak 
AND the game is final
AND MLB Play app is exited or backgrounded
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should receive a push notification (only once per each game and not the contest)
AND the notification contest should be randomly picked from the document 
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1oAVua_nZlopAzWljnOQAcAoWGljhdvf9dy45cKE2qIA/edit

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on PN
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to the app to the Beat the Streak game
